item.description:

In Kubernetes, a NetworkPolicy is like a bouncer for your pods. It checks who‚Äôs allowed to talk to whom and kicks out anything not on the guest list.

By default, Kubernetes is a friendly party where everyone can chat with everyone else‚Äîgreat for sociability, terrible for security. Network Policies let you enforce boundaries, like:
